org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.query.constraints

Interface AdapterAndIndexBasedQueryConstraints

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Persistable, QueryConstraints
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractVectorConstraints, CustomQueryConstraints, CustomQueryConstraintsWithFilter, OptimalCQLQuery, OptimalExpressionQuery, SpatialQuery, SpatialTemporalQuery, TemporalQuery

extends QueryConstraints

    • Method Detail

      • createQueryConstraints

        QueryConstraints createQueryConstraints(InternalDataAdapter<?> adapter,
                                        Index index,
                                        AdapterToIndexMapping indexMapping)

      • createFilters

        default List<QueryFilter> createFilters(Index index)
        Description copied from interface: QueryConstraints
        This is a list of filters (either client filters or distributed filters) which will be applied to the result set. QueryFilters of type DistributableQueryFilter will automatically be distributed across nodes, although the class must be on the classpath of each node. Fine-grained filtering and secondary filtering should be applied here as the primary index will only enable coarse-grained filtering.
        Specified by:
        createFilters in interface QueryConstraints
        Parameters:
        index - the index to create filters for
        Returns:
        A list of the query filters

      • getIndexConstraints

        default List<MultiDimensionalNumericData> getIndexConstraints(Index index)
        Description copied from interface: QueryConstraints
        Return a set of constraints to apply to the primary index based on the indexing strategy used. The ordering of dimensions within the index stategy must match the order of dimensions in the numeric data returned which will represent the constraints applied to the primary index for the query.
        Specified by:
        getIndexConstraints in interface QueryConstraints
        Parameters:
        index - The index used to generate the constraints for
        Returns:
        A multi-dimensional numeric data set that represents the constraints for the index
